qas.question: What year was the national Communications act enacted?
What Act clears the way for a National Communications Regulator?
What types of stakeholders consulted on the bill to enact the National Communications Act?
The National Communications Act is expected to create and invironment favorable for what?
Continued infrastructure development results in more efficient what?
How many people approved the National Communications Act?
When will the National Communications Regulator be put into place?
What sectors are unaffected by this act?

plausible_answers.text: government representatives and communications, academic and civil society stakeholders

qas.question: Who is the Somali Cabinet made up of?

context: On March 22, <a0_0><b6_0>2012<b6_0/><a0_0/>, the Somali Cabinet <b5_0>unanimously<b5_0/> approved <a1_0>the National Communications Act<a1_0/>, which paves the way for the establishment of a National Communications regulator in the <b7_0>broadcasting and telecommunications sectors<b7_0/>. The bill was passed following consultations between <b9_0>government representatives and communications, <a2_0><b8_0>academic and civil society<b8_0/><a2_0/> stakeholders<b9_0/>. According to the Ministry of Information, Posts and Telecommunication, the Act is expected to create an environment conducive to <a3_0>investment<a3_0/> and the certainty it provides will encourage further infrastructural development, resulting in more efficient <a4_0>service delivery<a4_0/>.
